data.title: Rochelle Humes and Josie Gibson share devastation after This Morning star's death
data.meta_description: They're among the stars to share their shock and sadness at the death of Sam Rubin following confirmation of his sudden death
data.text:
Rochelle Humes and Josie Gibson are among the This Morning stars to share their shock and sadness at the death of Sam Rubin following confirmation of his sudden death on Friday (May 10).

US veteran journalist Rubin “regularly broadcast live” into This Morning over the years, and was also an anchor for KTLA news in the US. "We have very heavy hearts this weekend with the news from Los Angeles that our Hollywood reporter Sam Rubin has died at the age of 64," This Morning said in a statement on social media.

“Sam was an Emmy-winning entertainment correspondent and presenter for Los Angeles’ No 1 morning show on KTLA, and regularly broadcast live into This Morning. He woke up Tinseltown every day for decades with his likeable charm and knowledgeable take on the movie world, he was on first-name terms with the stars and became affectionately known as ‘Hollywood Sam’. We will miss him."

READ MORE: Gemma Atkinson says 'I wouldn’t be with him' as she and Gorka Marquez address 'deal breaker'

Join our WhatsApp Top Stories and Breaking News group by clicking this link

The ITV show then confirmed: "There will be a tribute to Sam on Monday’s show, but in the meantime, we send our condolences to his wife Leslie, their four children and Sam’s colleagues at KTLA."

KTL was the first to comment on the loss of Rubin and said it is "profoundly saddened" by the news of his death. Sam was a giant in the local news industry and the entertainment world, and a fixture of Los Angeles morning television for decades,” a statement on X, formerly known as Twitter, said.

It continued: "His laugh, charm and caring personality touched all who knew him. Sam was a loving husband and father: the roles he cherished the most."

Following This Morning's post, presenters on the show were quick to share their condolences. "Devastating news. So so sad to hear this. Always the kindest and most generous! Praying for his family and loved ones," Rochelle wrote underneath This Morning's tribute, with her co-star Josie adding: "I love Sam. <3 So sad." Alison Hammond shared: "Condolences to Sams's family . He will be massively missed."

Craig Doyle penned: "So very sorry to hear this awful news, a true gentleman and a brilliant broadcaster…loved our chats. Ar dheis Dé go raibh a anam." Former This Morning presenter and Loose Women star Ruth Langsford shared: "So saddened to hear this news.I had the pleasure of working with Sam many times during my years on @thismorning Sam was a brilliant broadcaster and the loveliest man. Sending my condolences and love to his family and colleagues in America."

Among the other famous faces paying tribute across the pond was US actor Ben Stiller, who starred in Night At The Museum and Zoolander. He said on X: “So sad and sorry to hear of Sam Rubin’s passing. Consummate pro.

"I did my first interview with him in something like ‘93, and countless times over the years. He loved actors and movies. He made everyone feel comfortable and it was always fun and easy. He was an institution. We have lost him way too soon."
